programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Lucille Ball, The Jackson 5 (11/15/74)
programme.desc: Lucille Ball says she never misses one of Johnny's shows and takes a Cosmopolitan magazine quiz. The Jackson 5 sing two songs and talk about their plans for their time off.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Ann-Margret, Bruce Dern, Art Carney (1/22/75)
programme.desc: Ann-Margret gives Johnny a Swedish lesson then performs a musical number, Bruce Dern shares when he had his first kiss, and Art Carney shows up in his pajamas.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - George Peppard, Jill Ireland, Frank Abagnale, Pete Fountain (4/6/78)
programme.desc: Pete Fountain performs with the band. George Peppard wants to be cast as a song and dance man. Jill Ireland is a new horse owner. Noted conman Frank Abagnale appears.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jimmy Stewart, Don Adams, The Manhattan Transfer (5/14/80)
programme.desc: Carnac the Magnificent stops by. Jimmy Stewart reminisces about his film career. Get Smart's Don Adams has a new movie. The Manhattan Transfer performs.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Ringo Starr, Barbara Bach, The Oak Ridge Boys, Jerry Seinfeld (5/6/81)
programme.desc: Ringo Starr appears with his wife Barbara Bach. Jerry Seinfeld does his first Tonight Show standup. The Oak Ridge Boys perform.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Tim Conway, Willie Nelson (5/18/82)
programme.desc: Tim Conway went to one Hollywood party and his car got stolen. Johnny talks about filming a pet food commercial. Willie Nelson performs 2 songs.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Suzanne Pleshette, Dom Deluise, Bobby Fischer (11/8/72)
programme.desc: Suzanne Pleshette recites a poem. Chess champion Bobby Fischer does a numbers puzzle in just a few seconds. Dom DeLuise took a casserole into a sauna.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Jack Lemmon (1/3/73)
programme.desc: Johnny and Joan Rivers admit to stealing hotel soap; Jack Lemmon appears with the legendary director Billy Wilder

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Muhammad Ali, Robert Blake (2/8/73)
programme.desc: Johnny ribs Burbank during the monologue, Muhammad Ali details his training regimen, Robert Blake was embarassed to do a nude scene.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Clint Eastwood, Robert Klein, Buddy Hackett, Telly Savalas (4/3/73)
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood is on to talk Spaghetti Westerns and promote High Plains Drifter. Robert Klein does standup and Buddy Hackett drops in. Telly Savalas is about to do a TV series.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Leo Durocher, Don Rickles, Olga Fikotová (11/14/73)
programme.desc: Leo Durocher talks retirement, Don Rickles accidentally bumps Ed but gives him a kiss to make up for it, Olga Fikotová arm wrestles Johnny and gives a stretching lesson.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Tim Conway (9/15/77)
programme.desc: Johnny jokes about satellite findings before welcoming Tim Conway who talks about working on The Carol Burnett Show.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Embery, Buddy Hackett, Steve Martin (11/22/73)
programme.desc: Joan Embery brings out baby orangutans for Johnny and Ed, Buddy Hackett talks golf and tennis before sharing some snacks, Steve Martin does a comedy routine and plays the banjo.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Embery, Albert Brooks (7/25/79)
programme.desc: Johnny wonders if "abhor" is safe to say on television. Joan Embery of the San Diego Zoo brings out a seal and a baby gorilla. Albert Brooks is looking forward to the 1980s.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Steve Martin, Carl Sagan (9/26/80)
programme.desc: Steve Martin does his Wild and Crazy Guy character and orders dinner from a waiter. Johnny and Ed do a sketch on archaeology. Carl Sagan promotes Cosmos.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jimmy Stewart, Steve Martin (12/29/81)
programme.desc: Jimmy Stewart talks about visiting his daughter and going on an African safari before reading a poem. Steve Martin has Johnny read newspaper reviews of his acting.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Gilda Radner, Walter Cronkite (11/15/83)
programme.desc: Gilda Radner makes her one and only Tonight Show appearance promoting her book. Walter Cronkite misses doing the news.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd (6/6/84)
programme.desc: Johnny shares his voting experience. Dan Aykroyd is very passionate about psychic phenomena and his Ghostbusters co-star Bill Murray had fun at an industry dinner.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Billy Crystal, Lucille Thompson (3/27/86)
programme.desc: Johnny pokes fun at Dynasty before getting a martial arts lesson from black belt Lucille Thompson. Billy Crystal regales the audience with celebrity impressions.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Suzanne Pleshette, Dom Deluise, Bobby Fischer (11/8/72)
programme.desc: Suzanne Pleshette recites a poem. Chess champion Bobby Fischer does a numbers puzzle in just a few seconds. Dom DeLuise took a casserole into a sauna.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Jack Lemmon (1/3/73)
programme.desc: Johnny and Joan Rivers admit to stealing hotel soap; Jack Lemmon appears with the legendary director Billy Wilder

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Muhammad Ali, Robert Blake (2/8/73)
programme.desc: Johnny ribs Burbank during the monologue, Muhammad Ali details his training regimen, Robert Blake was embarassed to do a nude scene.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Clint Eastwood, Robert Klein, Buddy Hackett, Telly Savalas (4/3/73)
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood is on to talk Spaghetti Westerns and promote High Plains Drifter. Robert Klein does standup and Buddy Hackett drops in. Telly Savalas is about to do a TV series.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Leo Durocher, Don Rickles, Olga Fikotová (11/14/73)
programme.desc: Leo Durocher talks retirement, Don Rickles accidentally bumps Ed but gives him a kiss to make up for it, Olga Fikotová arm wrestles Johnny and gives a stretching lesson.
